TutorialÂ¶

In order to use VGM efficiently it is essential to acquire some basic knowledge about the underlying programming languages and the packages that provide the core functionality. The following tutorials / manuals are recommended:

  • Python language

    The official Python tutorial.

  • Numpy

    The numpy package provides a fast array class and a wealth of numerical functionality. As a primer, read the Numpy tutorial from scipy.org.

  • Cython

    Cython provides the possibility to produce fast compiled code with the clean and simple syntax of Python. Moreover, it eases the pain of interfacing with compiled libraries. Consult the user-guide and tutorial

  • iGraph-Python

    Here is an introduction to iGraph-Python. Since the class VascularGraph is derived from iGraph, most of the tutorial also applies to VGM.

  • Matplotlib

    Matplotlib provides publication quality 2D plotting (as well as some 3D plotting capabilities). Pyplot is the Matlab-like API that comes with Matplotlib. Also check out this highly useful gallery of plots to pick from and explore.

  • Sphinx

    Beautiful, semi-automatic code documentation (this manual is produced using Sphinx). Have a look at the official tutorial and a very useful 3rd party collection of hints. Also, there is a primer on reStructuredText.

  • Paraview

    Paraview 3D plotting is explained in depth here. A tutorial on Paraview Python-scripting can be found here.

  • VisIt

    Read the VisIt Manual and the tutorial on visit python scripting.

  • VGM

    The VGM code is documented inline. Explore classes and functions e.g. using ipython and introspection. A small, hands-on tutorial is provided in the form of SAGE worksheets.
